newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka stocks close down on retail sell-off.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka stocks close down on retail sell-off.

text.p: Sri Lanka stocks closed down for the second successive day on retail selling, but brokers said profit-taking should end soon due to a slow down in supply.
The all share index closed 5.6 points down at 734.20. Price declines led gains by 44 to 29. Commercial Bank fell 13 rupees to 192, Ceylon Tobacco one to 44, Hatton National Bank five to 280.

"Profit-taking is coming to an end because the supply of shares is drying up," said Thikshan Arulampalam of Lanka Securities. "There are very few large volumes of blue chips available at current market levels," he said.
